lead_paragraph: A New Jersey judge has denied a request by the former Giants defensive end Jeremiah Parker to reduce his 10-year prison term for a child-endangerment conviction.Parker was convicted in 2003 of endangering the welfare of a child after the death of Elijah Kelly, the 4-year-old son of Parker’s former girlfriend, Tauleah Kelly; Tauleah Kelly pleaded guilty in return for testifying against Parker and is serving a seven-year prison term.Elijah Kelly died May 14, 2001, from a head injury after abuse from his mother and Parker, prosecutors said.
